description: From Latin phylum, from Ancient Greek φῦλον (phûlon, “tribe, race”).

entries.meaning: (taxonomy) A rank in the classification of organisms, below kingdom and above class; also called a divisio or a division, especially in describing plants; a taxon at that rank
examples: Mammals belong to the phylum Chordata.

entries.meaning: (linguistics) A large division of possibly related languages, or a major language family which is not subordinate to another.
